title: Week 1: Introduction to Physical AI Quiz
description: Test your understanding of Physical AI fundamentals and ROS2 basics

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of ROS2 in robotics applications?

options.text: Robot middleware for communication and tools

questions.explanation: ROS2 (Robot Operating System 2) is a middleware framework that provides communication infrastructure, tools, and libraries for building robot applications.

questions.text: Which communication pattern in ROS2 allows for asynchronous data streaming?
questions.explanation: Topics use the publisher/subscriber pattern for asynchronous, streaming communication between nodes.

questions.text: What distinguishes 'Physical AI' from traditional robotics?

options.text: Integration of AI/ML for adaptive behavior in physical environments

questions.explanation: Physical AI combines robotics with AI/ML to create systems that can learn, adapt, and make decisions in real-world physical environments.

questions.text: Which ROS2 concept provides request/response style communication?
questions.explanation: Services provide synchronous request/response communication, where a client sends a request and waits for a response from a server.

options.text: A single executable that performs computation

questions.explanation: A ROS2 node is a process that performs computation. Nodes communicate with each other through topics, services, and actions.
